channel.title: Landing pages that capture user
channel.description:
I have seen quite a few times landing/signup pages from Adwords or similar don't easily allow the user to navigate away. For example they disable most of the menu's and so the page is essentially stand alone. An example is https://salon.mindbodyonline.com/salon-software
Have people tried this kind of landing page and found it generated more signups?

item.title: Landing pages that capture user
item.dc:creator: gravelld
item.description:
Yes, removing nav bars and footer links etc has worked for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Landing pages that capture user
item.dc:creator: craigvn
item.description:
Thanks for the link, I actually saw their signup page had no links. I think I am going to remove the nav as a 15% increase would be fairly significant for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Landing pages that capture user
item.dc:creator: NicheDiver
item.description:
HubSpot A/B tested links vs. no links. Here’s the writeup: http://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/landing-page-navigation-ht

Read full topic
